briefTitle: A 26-week Trial Comparing Efficacy and Safety of Insulin Degludec/Insulin Aspart BID and Insulin Degludec OD Plus Insulin Aspart in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Treated With Basal Insulin in Need of Treatment Intensification With Mealtime Insulin

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Diagnosis of type 2 Diabetes Mellitus at the discretion of the investigator for at least 26 weeks prior to screening (visit 1)
* Treatment with basal insulin for at least 12 weeks prior to randomisation with or without metformin, sulphonylurea (SU)/glinide, DPP-4 inhibitors, alfa-glucosidase-inhibitors
* HbA1c 7.0% - 10.0%
* Body mass index (BMI) less than or equal to 40.0 kg/m\^2

Exclusion Criteria:

* Treatment with glucose-lowering agent(s) other than those stated in the inclusion criteria
* Stroke; heart failure New York Heart Association (NYHA) class III or IV; myocardial infarction; unstable angina pectoris; or coronary arterial bypass graft or angioplasty
* Chronic disorder or disease which might jeopardise safety or compliance
* Malignant neoplasms
* Recurrent severe hypoglycaemia

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in HbA1c (%)
outcomeMeasures.description: Change from baseline in HbA1c (%) after 26 weeks of treatment

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG)
outcomeMeasures.description: Change from baseline in FPG after 26 weeks of treatment

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Treatment Emergent Hypoglycaemic Episodes
outcomeMeasures.description: According to the Novo Nordisk definition for confirmed hypoglycaemic episodes (severe hypoglycaemia and/or a measured Plasma Glucose (PG) \<3.1 mmol/L(56 mg/dL))

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Treatment Emergent Hypoglycaemic Episodes
outcomeMeasures.description:
According to the American Diabetes Association (ADA) definition following are the categories of hypoglycaemic episodes:

Severe hypoglycaemia, Documented symptomatic hypoglycaemia, Asymptomatic hypoglycaemia, Probable symptomatic hypoglycaemia and Relative hypoglycaemia

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Treatment Emergent Nocturnal (00:01-05:59 am) Confirmed Hypoglycaemic Episodes
outcomeMeasures.description: Nocturnal hypoglycaemic episodes are defined as occurring between 00:01 and 05:59 a.m.

outcomeMeasures.title: Incidence of Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAE)
outcomeMeasures.description: A TEAE was defined as an event that has onset date on or after the first day of exposure to randomised treatment and no later than 7 days after the last day of randomised treatment
